Message.Issue: Change 'ErrorHandler.ErrorMessageBox(string, Control, int, bool)' to call the MessageBox.Show overload that specifies MessageBoxOptions, and make sure to set MessageBoxOptions.RightAlign and MessageBoxOptions.RtlReading if RightToLeft is set to RightToLeft.Yes on the parent control.
Initialize all static fields in 'FoodRelated' when those fields are declared and remove the explicit static constructor.
Change 'FoodRelated.CaloriesPerServingList' to be read-only by removing the property setter.
Change 'FoodRelated.DefinersList' to be read-only by removing the property setter.
Change 'FoodRelated.FoodNameList' to be read-only by removing the property setter.
Change 'FoodRelated.ServingSizeList' to be read-only by removing the property setter.

The 'this' parameter (or 'Me' in Visual Basic) of 'Functions.DumpFoodPropertiesList(TextBox, NumericUpDown, NumericUpDown, TextBox)' is never used. Mark the member as static (or Shared in Visual Basic) or use 'this'/'Me' in the method body or at least one property accessor, if appropriate.

The 'this' parameter (or 'Me' in Visual Basic) of 'Storage.CheckRegistryValues(string, string)' is never used. Mark the member as static (or Shared in Visual Basic) or use 'this'/'Me' in the method body or at least one property accessor, if appropriate.

The 'this' parameter (or 'Me' in Visual Basic) of 'Storage.ReadFoodTable(string, string)' is never used. Mark the member as static (or Shared in Visual Basic) or use 'this'/'Me' in the method body or at least one property accessor, if appropriate.

'Storage.ReadRegistry(string, string)' calls 'DateTime.TryParseExact(string, string[], IFormatProvider, DateTimeStyles, out DateTime)' but does not explicitly check whether the conversion succeeded. Either use the return value in a conditional statement or verify that the call site expects that the out argument will be set to the default value when the conversion fails.

The 'this' parameter (or 'Me' in Visual Basic) of 'Storage.ReadRegistry(string, string)' is never used. Mark the member as static (or Shared in Visual Basic) or use 'this'/'Me' in the method body or at least one property accessor, if appropriate.

Because the behavior of 'float.ToString()' could vary based on the current user's locale settings, replace this call in 'Storage.ReadRegistry(string, string)' with a call to 'float.ToString(IFormatProvider)'. If the result of 'float.ToString(IFormatProvider)' will be displayed to the user, specify 'CultureInfo.CurrentCulture' as the 'IFormatProvider' parameter. Otherwise, if the result will be stored and accessed by software, such as when it is persisted to disk or to a database, specify 'CultureInfo.InvariantCulture'.

The 'this' parameter (or 'Me' in Visual Basic) of 'Storage.WriteFoodTable(string, string, string[])' is never used. Mark the member as static (or Shared in Visual Basic) or use 'this'/'Me' in the method body or at least one property accessor, if appropriate.

The 'this' parameter (or 'Me' in Visual Basic) of 'Storage.WriteRegistry(string, string, bool)' is never used. Mark the member as static (or Shared in Visual Basic) or use 'this'/'Me' in the method body or at least one property accessor, if appropriate.

Rule.Name: Collection properties should be read only
Rule.Description: Properties that return collections should be read-only so that users cannot entirely replace the backing store. Users can still modify the contents of the collection by calling relevant methods on the collection. Note that the XmlSerializer class has special support for deserializing read-only collections. See the XmlSerializer overview for more information.
Rule.Resolution: Change {0} to be read-only by removing the property setter.

Rule.Name: Do not ignore method results
Rule.Description: The result of methods that return new instances of strings should be assigned to a variable and subsequently used. If the result of a method that creates a new object, such as String.ToLower(), is not assigned to a variable, the call is wasted.
Rule.Resolution: {0} calls {1} but does not explicitly check whether the conversion succeeded. Either use the return value in a conditional statement or verify that the call site expects that the out argument will be set to the default value when the conversion fails.

Rule.Name: Initialize reference type static fields inline
Rule.Description: Static fields should be initialized when declared. Initializing static data in explicit static constructors results in less performant code.
Rule.Resolution: Initialize all static fields in {0} when those fields are declared and remove the explicit static constructor.

Rule.Name: Mark members as static
Rule.Description: Methods which do not access instance data or call instance methods can be marked as static (Shared in Visual Basic). After doing so, the compiler will emit non-virtual call sites to these members which will prevent a check at runtime for each call that ensures the current object pointer is non-null. This can result in a measurable performance gain for performance-sensitive code. In some cases, the failure to access the current object instance represents a correctness issue.
Rule.Resolution: The 'this' parameter (or 'Me' in Visual Basic) of {0} is never used. Mark the member as static (or Shared in Visual Basic) or use 'this'/'Me' in the method body or at least one property accessor, if appropriate.

Rule.Name: Specify IFormatProvider
Rule.Description: If an overload exists that takes an IFormatProvider argument, it should always be called in favor of an overload that does not. Some methods in the runtime convert a value to or from a string representation and take a string parameter that contains one or more characters, called format specifiers, which indicate how the value is to be converted. If the meaning of the format specifier varies by culture, a formatting object supplies the actual characters used in the string representation. In scenarios where sorting and comparison behavior should never change between cultures, specify CultureInfo.InvariantCulture, otherwise, specify CultureInfo.CurrentCulture.
Rule.Resolution: Because the behavior of {0} could vary based on the current user's locale settings, replace this call in {1} with a call to {2}. If the result of {2} will be displayed to the user, specify {3} as the 'IFormatProvider' parameter. Otherwise, if the result will be stored and accessed by software, such as when it is persisted to disk or to a database, specify {4}.

Rule.Name: Specify MessageBoxOptions
Rule.Description: In order to run correctly on right-to-left systems, all calls to MessageBox.Show should use the overload that specifies MessageBoxOptions as an argument. Programs should detect whether they are running on a right-to-left system at run-time and pass the appropriate MessageBoxOptions value in order to display correctly.
Rule.Resolution: Change {0} to call the MessageBox.Show overload that specifies MessageBoxOptions, and make sure to set MessageBoxOptions.RightAlign and MessageBoxOptions.RtlReading if RightToLeft is set to RightToLeft.Yes on the parent control.
